listing.listing_description: Indulge yourself in sun, golf and more of the Mallorca good life at Villa Gaspar. This luxury Palma vacation rental is close to several golf courses, boating ports, the beach and more. Of course, you can also simply enjoy the views of mountains and water from the private grounds, well-appointed modern living spaces and four comfortable bedrooms.You can’t miss the views over the Bay of Santa Ponsa and the Tramuntana Mountains from the villa’s garden and terraces. Savor the vistas from a lounge chair by the heated pool, the sunny outdoor sitting area, the shaded outdoor kitchen with barbecue, or an al-fresco dining table with seating for eight. Set the mood throughout the villa with the multi-room sound system, and share photos of your holiday with friends and family back home via Wi-Fi.A quarter-acre of carefully landscaped gardens and classic Spanish architecture give Villa Gaspar a stately, traditional look. Inside, the house is warm, colorful and inviting, with spacious rooms and vibrant accents. Catch up on the living room’s jaunty striped sofas or settle into the iconic Eames lounger for a mid-century-style nap, and, in the dining room, slip into slipcovered chairs for a meal with views across the bay. The kitchen is fully equipped and features both a practical breakfast bar and cheering cabinetry in a sunny shade of yellow.The villa has two bedrooms with king beds and en-suite bathrooms, one of which opens to a terrace. The other two bedrooms are ideal for parents traveling with children: one has a king bed, the other has a king bed that converts to two twins, and they share a bathroom.Villa Gaspar puts you close to the island’s must-enjoy activities, from golf and boating to beachgoing. Guests are a 15-minute drive or less from chartering a boat for a honeymoon-style cruise at the Club Nautico Santa Ponsa marina, teeing off at Golf Santa Ponsa or exploring downtown Palma de Mallorca. If you’re after sun and sand, there’s plenty of room on the golden stretch of nearby Playa Santa Ponsa.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Terraces, great room, and bedrooms all command sea views at this contemporary Côte d’Azur villa. Built into the rock face above the Bay of Villefranche, this modern home balances natural scenery—rocks, pines, water—with sheets of windows and even a glass elevator. Drive 3.5 kilometers downhill to the colorful buildings and clear-water beaches in Villefranche-sur-Mer.This villa is all about the views, whether you spot cruise ships from the infinity swimming pool on the rooftop, claim a spot on one of the plentiful chaise longues, or watch the sunset over dinner from the barbecue at the alfresco dining area.And the panoramas don’t stop when you step indoors, thanks to nearly wall-to-wall windows overlooking both the harbor and the hillside. Clean-lined pieces like chrome armchairs, a hanging fireplace, and minimalist pendant lights add interest but not distraction in the living room, dining room, and fully equipped kitchen. Each of the 5 suite-style bedrooms is designed to offer sea views in a solarium-like setting.This vacation rental is just above the town of Villefranche-sur-Mer, a Riviera classic that’s a favorite retreat for royalty and celebs, and a favorite filming location for Hollywood. Pack a picnic to eat on one of the town’s public beaches or ease into the rhythm of life in France and stop at a waterfront café for a drink. You’re also close enough to Nice and Monaco for a day trip along the coast.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: The word “fairytale” is often used when describing small European villages, especially when they’re vacation destinations. Ronda plays out more like a novel or a classic film. The works of Ernest Hemingway and Orson Welles suggest the same, as both spent many summers living in Ronda, taking inspiration from the beautiful city and its rich historical influence. Hacienda Bodeguera celebrates Ronda in the same way with its peaceful, serene atmosphere located just a few kilometers from the historic center.Hacienda Bodeguera merges Spain’s historic past and stylish present within its four en-suite bedrooms, gated estate. Spanish colonial architecture is represented by ancient stone walls, exposed wood beams, a clay-tiled roof, and the villa’s numerous openings to the beautiful outdoors. On the modern side, Bodeguera uses clean lines, minimalistic decor, and an open concept floor plan to create a space that is both elegant and calming. Outside, Bodeguera is decorated with mature trees, lush greenery, and dynamic views of the distant mountains and valley below.Inside, the villa is outfitted with a fully equipped kitchen, wine cellar, espresso machine, and formal dining for ten. There’s a wood burning fireplace, sauna air conditioning, Smart television, and Wi-Fi to keep you comfortable and connected. Outside, alfresco dining can be arranged for up to forty guests, making Bodeguera ideal for large social gatherings. There’s a charcoal barbeque, wood-fired oven, children’s play area, and infinity swimming pool on the terrace as well.Ronda is really an incredible city, and if you dig in and immerse yourself, you won't be disappointed. Start your exploration with Ronda’s three bridges, Romano, Viejo, and Nuevo, all three of which span the Tajo Canyon, offering breathtaking views of the city and cliffs. Another must-see in Ronda is the Corrida Goyesca, the bullfighting ring. Built at the end of the eighteenth century, this beautiful Neoclassical structure was the first bullfighting ring in Spain. After, follow Ronda’s ancient winding streets and you’ll discover delicious cuisine, boutique shops, cafes and bars, and some of the World’s most inspiring scenery and architecture.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Gilt-edged portraits look down on a tiled foyer and the namesake 4 towers look out to the sea at this 19th-century estate just north of Barcelona. The mansion still rises amid a tranquil pond and groves of pine and eucalyptus on 5 private acres on the Maresme Coast—the hottest holiday spot for wealthy Barcelonians in the 1800s. Join the volleyball players on Montgat Beach after a 9-minute drive. Each morning of your stay begins with breakfast service. From there, greet the day with a stroll under the 200-year-old trees that dot the grounds, a few laps in the saltwater swimming pool, a nap in one of the loungers in the sun, or pintxos savored in the al-fresco living and dining areas. Though this vacation rental has its roots in the 1800s, today it has a satellite TV and Wi-Fi, too. The villa’s grand foyer, living rooms, and formal dining room make an impression of imposing luxury with their gilt-framed paintings, coffered ceilings, tiered chandeliers, and graceful seating. The breakfast nook, meanwhile, has playful bird-print wallpaper, and the fully equipped kitchen is a little island of contemporary style with a sleek breakfast bar. Each of the five bedrooms in this home has two twin beds that can be arranged as a king bed; all but one of the bedrooms have en-suite bathrooms. For larger parties of friends or family, there’s also a spare room with two twin sofa beds and an en-suite bathroom. Pop into the village center of Alella to sample the area’s wines, toast a honeymoon-worthy dinner over a glass of cava, or pick up a local perfume to remember your trip to Spain by. It’s less than a 5-minute walk to neighborhood landmarks like Can Cuiros, and less than a 10-minute drive to the golden sand of Montgat Beach. Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: A serene atmosphere, stunning views and one of the best beaches on Ibiza: you’ll find it all at Villa Vista Cala Jondal. As its name implies, the villa has panoramic views of the beach at Cala Jondal; what’s not mentioned is the location close to the airport and town of Ibiza, so you can be on that beach in no time. But six suite-style bedrooms, luxe amenities and modern architecture make the villa a place you’ll want to stay.In front of the villa, a long terrace and infinity pool stretch out toward the sea, surrounded by palm and orange trees and flower beds. You could easily spend the day relaxing in the chaise longues and hammock on the terrace or just as easily follow the path down to the tennis court. Find a respite from the midday heat in the shaded al-fresco lounge area, and as the sun sets, cook local seafood on the barbecue and enjoy at the outdoor dining area. Spend a romantic evening on the rooftop terrace, which has its own lounge area. For comfort and convenience, the villa has air conditioning and Wi-Fi; for pure fun, it has a ping-pong table, too.The monochromatic white color scheme at Villa Vista Cala Jondal creates a calm, sophisticated atmosphere that’s enlivened by texture. In the living room, which opens to the terrace via two sets of sliding doors and offers excellent views, a shag rug is a plush base for a sleek white sectional, silver lounge chair and glossy white cabinets. Just through an open doorway is the dining room, which seats ten in Lucite chairs around a white Parsons table. The kitchen is adjacent to the dining area and hides a full set of equipment behind minimalist white surfaces.There are five bedrooms in the main house at Villa Vista Cala Jondal and one in the guest house; all six have en-suite bathrooms with stand-alone showers. The master suite in the main house has a king bed and opens to the terrace. Two of the other main-house bedrooms have king beds, and the other two have twin beds. The bedroom in the guest house has two twin beds.If you’re flying to Ibiza, you’ll find it’s just an 8-minute drive from Ibiza Airport to the villa, so you can be off the plane and on a lounge by the pool in a hurry. You can also be at some of Ibiza’s best beaches in a flash; from the villa, it’s a 2 km drive to the Tropicana Beach Club on Cala Jondal, about 17 km to both Playa Bella and Ocean Beach and 24 km to Punta Galera. Shopping, dining and nightlife are a 30 km drive away in Ibiza Town.Copyright © 2015 Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.
